params.textField:
This activity is related to section 3.1 of Chapter 7 of the book.

Take a look at Figure 2 in Chapter 7 (repeated here for your convenience). This figure represents a kind of neuron activation function which is called a "hyperbolic tangent" or "tanh" sigmoid. According to this figure, when the stimulus is about +2, the activation of the neuron is around *0.96*, when the stimulus is around *-0.55* the activation is around -0.5, and when the stimulus is +1, the activation is around *0.76*.
